} } } Length:: 0:37 Mins(Actual pictures) Short and very sweet. I'm having a lot of fun with this camera. You won't believe the quality of your night shots. Buy it! You'll see what I mean, that's if, you haven't already.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: mallrose
Reviews.Content: I'm a novice photographer, just needing a camera to take pics of my daughters doing anything from parties to sports like basketball. With that being said, this camera has exceeded my expectations. I needed a camera that can take pictures in very low light, action shots in the bright sun, and everything in between. So, far it's done all of this flawlessly.One other thing that I really love is the "in-camera" photo editing, especially the red-eye removal. No more loading up a program, opening the picture, circling the eyes...etc. It's all done automatically.This has been a great camera for me!

Reviews.Title: Great step up.
Reviews.Author: J. Groen
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera the other day and have been very impressed so far. I previously used an Olympus Stylus 760 and that camera is nothing compared to this new Sony. Things that I have noticed so far in comparison to that camera are:-Much faster. Focusing, shutter lag, etc.-Sharper pictures. Everything is so clear. Makes the Olympus' lens seem soft.-Just an overall joy to use. This camera makes me want to keep shooting rather than just taking pictures when they may come up.Haven't done too much low light shooting yet so can't really judge on that but what I have done so far seems to be a clear step up from my Olympus. I haven't found any major cons to this camera yet as it is still new and exciting to me. I just have to keep remembering to take off the lens cap when I turn it on. So overall this camera is a great point and shoot with a great zoom with excellent image stabilization that also allows a good amount of manual control. It is no DSLR that is for sure but it is not intended to be so I cannot judge it on that. This camera definitely deserves a look by anyone who does not need a compact camera and appreciates a powerful optical zoom and manual control.

Reviews.Title: Sony DSCH50
Reviews.Author: Donald J. Harris
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera. We use it for sports events. The first and second shot response is terific to catch the rapid activity of soccer, lacrosse, and swimming. For the first time we are able to use the zoom while shooting movies. The stability system allows us to zoom across the field or pool and get stable movies. With the rapid continuous shooting mode we were able to get clear photos of player movement to improve strokes and dives for competition swimming. I have some trouble operating the jog control. But my wife has no problem with her smaller fingers and by using her fingernails.

Reviews.Title: Just my opinion
Reviews.Author: B. Jackson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after returning a Canon SX100 IS, a Nikon L100, and a 10mp Sony that was so horrible I forgot the model number.  I've read through many of the reviews on this site posted on this camera.  Some "Cons" I've read are: *Requires a Sony memory stick (I purchased 4gig memory stick at Radio Shack and the amount of photos it stores seems endless even at full resolution).  *The lens hood gets in the way (When I opened the box, the lens was packaged with the 2 piece hood turned backwards and locked within itself.  I'm also guilty of attaching it to the camera that way, and yes! it does get in the way.  But, if you assemble it properly, it doesn't get in the way.)  *The hood is visible in the photo (that's true, but very easily overcome by zooming till it's not visible.  Also, the small amount of "hood" visible can easily be cropped out of the photo.  Usually when I use the hood it's because I'm zooming, it's very sunny out, etc.  So personally, this hasn't be an issue at all).  *Must extend the lens to view, load photos, etc. (Actually you can press the 'play' button and view, load, delete photos without extending the lens.  After doing so, you can press the power button and it will shut down)Doesn't focus properly (With any lens / camera there are limitations!  I have a 50mm prime lens on my Nikon D300 and many times it won't focus clearly.  The issue is usually your too close for the lens / AF to properly focus.  With the H50 you need to be at wide angle and simply move closer to the subject.  If your close and zooming many times....  that basically creates a condition of being too close for the AF.  The macro on the camera requires you to be VERY close most times so it's just a matter or playing with the wide angle / zoom and moving closer.  The things I really like about the camera is the ability to use manual modes.  The shutter speed / aperture are "virtual', so it's more of a novelty versus something you'll see very noticeable differences with.  However, the manual modes allows you to select from a few setting that adjust the color saturation, etc.  And that is one of my favorite features.  Also, few point and shoot cameras offer a remote control, and that's what really won me over on this camera, as did the tilt screen.  The tilt screen allows you to change your shooting perspective without laying on the floor / ground to see the screen.  I have a 3 year old son and usually hold my camera at waist level and flip the screen so I'm looking down at it.  The difference between taking pics that way versus aiming downward is AMAZING.  Also, the remote not only allows you to get in the photo, but....  if your taking photos of children, etc. your able to place the camera on a tripod and work on getting that smile out there... while not holding the camera!!!  As with every point and shoot camera I've ever used or owned, you have to take 3 or 4 photos to get the one you want and this camera is no exception.

Reviews.Title: sONY dsc h50 REVIEW
Reviews.Author: N. Marshall
Reviews.Content: I have been diligently reading reviews on cameras in this class and ran out of time and had to make a decision, so picked this one over the Cannon S5.  Not sure if that was the correct decision after viewing the image quality.Overal I very much like the controls and features, especially the face ID which is of course not unique to this camera.  The 3 inch LCD screen is also excellent and the tilt feature is useful for odd angle shots.  I have small children and don't always want to kneel down for pics.  The tiltable screen allows me to stand and still take shots at the kids level.So, all was great until viewing the pics on my PC.  I am not a pro and probably couldn't tell noise from chromatic aberrations if they hit me in the face, so my opinion is purely amateur, so take this with a grain of salt.  Pics were viewed with Microsoft Media Player (or the photo equivalent that comes with Vista).  Most were 5 megpaixel and some at 9.I mostly used the face ID facility and took the pics once the face was detected and indicated "green".  Overall I am frustrated at the lack of sharpness, some of which might be explained by the size of the pic rendered on the PC screen which is at least 8x10 and usually larger.  Practically every pic I took, regardless of being taken outside with plenty of light or inside using flash were not as sharp as I would like.Color rendering is pleasant and generally natural but to me, if the pic isn't sharp, nothing else matters.I also own a Sony DSC H 1 which has roughly the same level of sharpness, but the sharpness is adjustable, but not on this camera (unless I haven't come across it in the MENU).  I overcame the lack of sharpnes to some degree on my H1 by shooting in Shutter priority and keeping the shutter speed up as much as possible.  May have to do the same with this camera which is disappointing.I realize the D SLR's have larger sensors and would have opted for one of those, except I didn't want to have a separate camera and camcorder.  Plus the multiple lenses is expensive and a bit of a pain.Any tips on sharpening the pics are welcome.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Todd C. Keyser
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a trip to Europe that me and my wife were planning on taking and the camera hit a homerun. The ISO setting does a great job inside cathedrals which tend to be fairly dark. I was able to take pretty good interior pictures without a flash. My wife stopped taking pictures with her camera after she saw mine. The only thing you have to watch out for is people walking through your shot when shooting on the ISO setting because any movement in the shot is blurred.The one feature that was a pleasant surprise is the rotating LCD screen. When everyone around me was bending over backwards to take shots of the cathedral domes and ceilings, I was able to rotate the screen out and shoot straight up. The rotating screen was also great when I was taking pictures in crowds because I could raise the camera over my head with the screen rotated down and get great shots.Once I got home and played around with the pictures I realized that I could zoom in on the pictures I took and still have a very sharp picture. I kind of regret zooming in too much now on some of my shots because I chopped off some things that I did not notice until I was reviewing the pictures on my computer. The zoom is awesome! It was neat to be able to take pictures from a distance and then zoom in on areas for detailed pictures. Just don't get over zealous and leave some extra room around your shot because you can always crop the picture later.Most of my pictures were extremely sharp, but a few were a bit fuzzy. I think the fuzziness was more user error than anything else. Based on the sharpness of the other pictures I am guessing that I either rushed the picture or had the camera on the wrong setting.The large LCD screen is great although it is hard to see in bright sunlight. I still loved the screen and the fact that it rotates up and down.Battery life is decent. I bought a second battery and just swapped them when one battery would get low. The 4 GB card is all you will need. I took close to 1000 pictures on the highest setting along with some video.The video taking ability of this camera is very good.  The video is sharp and clear and looks like it came from a camcorder.

Reviews.Title: sony cybershot h50
Reviews.Author: victoria
Reviews.Content: this camera is awesome!! i am so thrilled with it so far and i still have lots to learn.The Auto button gave me great prof/quality like pictures...and the family responded the same way to the pics i sent.  I was never satisfied with my other  digital cameras, the battery life Sucked!! i had many precious moments i missed because of my camera had to charge for a light or it had a silly delay time on it that would drive me ever lovin' crazy,so therefore i had no fun taking pictures at all.Disney was the worst because i had to carry this bag with all my lithium batteries,regular and my rechargeables..and still did not solve the problem...i missed what would have been some timeles memories at Disney world...i sure wish i had my Sony at that time..i would have been so happy.Hey we live and learn, i'm just glad my kids are still young enough to want to go back to Disney and we can do it allover again with my Sony.I had sold it already the first day i took it out, a lady had stopped me in the street and asked what kind of camera i was using and loved the quality of photos it took,my co workers loved it too...so all in all this is the best by far.I love the battery  it's cool!plug in the wall charge in no time and voila! you are good for days...it's a camera you've got to have if you are an amateur and ready to step up a notch.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Gina Santonas "Gina S 13"
Reviews.Content: I am in love with my new camera.  I have the smaller Sony that is great to throw in your purse.  Both have the Carl Zeiss lens that takes incredibly sharp shots.  I rarely have to fix a photo.I bought the DSCH50 for the stronger zoom and I am again amazed at the quality and price of the Sony cameras.

Reviews.Title: Terrible - Stay Clear
Reviews.Author: Every Now and Then
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife and found that there is a high level of color noise when using flash no matter the amount of light in the room and focus is imprecise.  My wife is going back to an older Canon S2IS model which has a better focus and less noise.  This is a good example of what happens when you increase megapixels without increasing the sensor size.  Stay clear there are better cameras out there in the same price point.

Reviews.Title: I call it my "magic" camera...
Reviews.Author: C. DeRosa
Reviews.Content: I couldn't be more pleased with this camera. It takes absolutely beautiful pictures with very little effort on my part. I did a lot of research before buying, and I seriously could not have made a better choice! I've been using it for about a year now, and here are my observations...Pros:- The zoom! It gives me access to pictures I never could have taken with my old Canon Powershot.- The picture quality. I hardly ever need to use the other camera modes, because the Auto setting takes amazing pictures on its own. The color is vivid, the images are sharp...it often makes you look like a pro!- The flexibility. The flash and focus have several different (and easily accessed) settings that enable you to tailor them to your picture. This really came in handy when I had to take very close-up pictures of plants for a Vegetation class. The pictures I took were perfectly focused, something many of the students in my class had a hard time with.- The display. It's huge! Not only that, but you can pop it out and tilt it this way and that, allowing you to see what you're doing if taking a picture from an odd angle.- The ease of use. The controls are quite intuitive, and the menus are simple to use annd understand.Cons:-The battery. While it's great to be able to recharge the battery and not worry about buying new ones all the time, the downside is that you're limited to the charge you have in your camera - once it runs out you'd better hope you're near a plug, and even then, it'll be while before you can use it again. I'm studying abroad in Ireland this summer, and I plan to buy a spare (or maybe 2!) that I can charge up and carry around as backup. Because as nice as all the features are, they eat up battery life fast.- The bulk. No matter how much I love the zoom and display, they sure do make it big. Of course, this is to be expected with this kind of camera. Just keep in mind that this is a camera you will lug around, rather than just slipping it in your back pocket. It's totally worth it, though!If you're looking for something that takes incredible pictures, but is easy to use, this is your camera. No matter what I'm taking a picture of - be it flowers  or wildlife or running children - I'm never disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Everything an amatuer needs
Reviews.Author: Red Ryder
Reviews.Content: I was more of a photography buff when I was younger, but never a professional. For my new camera I was looking for a camera that would be quick and easy most of the time, but allow me to take control of more of the functions when I wanted to. After reviewing a lot of different cameras, this Sony seemed to match what I needed.Sony Cyber-shot DSCH50 9.1 MP Digital Camera with 15x Optical Zoom with Super Steady ShotI'm not big on reading instructions, and I was able to quickly use the camera without them. A few functions needed a quick lookup, but most are intuitive. I took the camera on our trip to Disneyworld, and shot 3,800 photos on our 12 day visit.Everything about the camera worked well. With the basic setting on, I was able to take quick and easy shots of the kids and the family, and they all worked well. I spent much of the time on the continuous shot function, even on the automatic mode. In this mode the quick captures really allowed me to get lots of great photos of the kids that otherwise would have been missed. My only quip about the continuous shutter is that the speed is not consistant, its starts quickly, then the clicks slow down while it processes, then it speeds up again. That's a minor issue, I still built some great sequences of my three year old twin boys.When I turned to manual mode, the settings were easy to use, and I was able to make some great images. I'll post some pictures of fireworks and animals that I took using manual mode, they came out great. The image stabilization worked great as well, the fireworks shots were taken with the camera on a beanbag on a metal railing. Even with a 3 second shutter speed, the child 10 feet away kicking the railing was clearly felt in my arms, but not in the image.The colors came out great, the images clear, even at full zoom.I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this camera for thos that, like me, use a camera for quick shots usually but occasionally like more control.

Reviews.Title: Just what I was looking for
Reviews.Author: maximum verbosity
Reviews.Content: I searched for several months when I decided to go a step-up from my Canon point-and-shoot.  I liked the idea of a digital SLR, except for the fact that I couldn't find one that also recorded sound and video.  This was very important to me because I liked the convenience of the point-and-shoot having a built in video recorder and didn't want to have to start carrying two separate cameras around.  But I also wanted the versatility of being able to change lenses, something I wasn't going to get with most of the cameras that had video capability.  The thing that finally sold me on this camera was that I was getting the best of both worlds; video recording and something like a digital slr....this camera is actually called a hybrid because it has a really simple point-n-shoot setting, but also has the capability of setting all of the photographer-techie stuff like aperature, etc. manually.The neatest thing is the smile detector.  When this is on, you can point the camera at a person and the minute they smile, it takes the picture.  You can set it to focus just on children's smiles (which is helpful in a group shot) or just adults or if it's only one person in the photo, just when they smile.The macro-lense setting is amazing, I love the detail and depth I've gotten when using this setting.  And the ability to virtually switch lenses is pretty neat too.  The lense itself is a Carl Zeiss so you know it's top of the line, probably better than you'd find with a digital slr, most of those cameras don't even include a lense in the price of the camera purchase, so that's a separate expense.The camera is lightweight, but feels solid in your hand.  I haven't read the handbook so all of the photos I've taken have been just from messing around with it and I've gotten some pretty good shots.  I'm sure once I read the manual, my pretty good shots will become amazing because this camera can do it.The battery life is good so far.  Not as good as a point and shoot, but I can use the camera everyday for several days, a few shots here and there, before I have to charge it in the included wall charger.The only negative thing I can find is that the memory card is too small to fit into the card reader on my laptop (A Toshiba Satellite) so I bought an adapter when I bought a new card.  However, I can't get them to work properly together, I get error messages and end up having to get the pictures off of the camera by hooking it up via USB.  Which isn't a big deal, I just like the convenience of popping the card out of the camera and into my laptop and not messing with finding the cord or having it with me when I want to get my pictures.  But otherwise, I am very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Sara Chronister
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with this camera.  It's taken some great pictures!  I'd been buying the $100 cheapo ones but trying to get a photo of my active 2-year old was impossible!  With this camera, I haven't had a problem, I even have one picture of him running flat out, both feet off the ground, and he's not blurry at all.  I highly recommend this camera.  I'm still playing with the manual settings, like aperature and shutter speed, but even those are fairly simple to learn since the readouts are right there on the screen.  Highly, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: So Far So Good
Reviews.Author: T-Bone
Reviews.Content: Got this camera a week ago, and am happy so far, I am not an experienced photographer by any means and I will admit that there is more functions than I can use, but it does come equipped with easy to understand functions for those of us that just want to take some good family pictures.  I used it at my sons football game last night and had a little trouble with blurry pics when they were moving, I even tried it in the sports shooting mode and the pics justcame out dark. When they did stand still, the pictures were great.  I do have some advice about getting that extra lithium battery for a back up.  First of all I recommend it for those times that you need to get those important shots and the battery goes dead. This camera only uses the "infoLithium" style batterys, DO NOT purchase a cheaper one from other battery stores, you will get a black screen that tells you that you need to use only "infolithium batteries" and will have to return it as I did.  I will tell you that Buy.com had the best price for this battery (sorry Amazon).  If a lot of functions and settings confuse you, then this may not be the camera for you, but if you have some knowledge of camera function than this is a great buy.  I will also mention that I had a little trouble finding a camera bag to fit this camera.  Sony has a case that says it will fit, but it looks like there would not be too much more room for extra items that I like to carry with my camera.  I did find a case at ebags.com from Crumpler called "the 3 million dollar"  the best way to describe it is a small version of a book bag.  it has great protection for the camera and is very comfortable to wear and has room for the extras I mentioned.  Hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber-shot DSCH50 9.1 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Rita
Reviews.Content: What a geat camera! The zoom feature is really a plus. And the pictures are very clear. We find another great feature everytime we use it. This camera comes with the best download program we have ever had. Would highly recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: sony cyber shot review
Reviews.Author: Virginia M. Coleman
Reviews.Content: A very lightweight, extremely diverse camera that performs well in just about every situation from bright sun to darkness. The 18x zoom eliminates the need for multiple lenses and there is virtually no delay at all once the shutter is pressed. A fun to use camera all in one package.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: DARTH
Reviews.Content: I got this camera shortly after it became available and have been fairly happy with it. I don't know of any other camera that has the combination of features this one has, especially at this price. The large, tiltable screen and the nightshot feature makes this camera extremely versitile.Of course the quality of the nightshot photos leave quite a bit to be desired, but without it no night photos would have been possible. That more than makes up for the poor quality.As far as the overall quality of the pictures are concirned, there are far better cameras on the market, but they are far more expensive, much heavier to tote around and require much more expertise to operate properly.I have found that for most pictures I shoot this camera is fine.

Reviews.Title: Everything you could want in a camera...
Reviews.Author: John Adams
Reviews.Content: ...and more.  Not being a trained photographer, but still wanting a nice, simple camera, this one is the perfect balance.  The zoom is great, it's intuitive to use and has great features overall.  While the DSLRs are getting cheaper, I recommend this one if you're not a seasoned photgrapher, as it's so simple yet powerful.

Reviews.Title: Solid Affordable Camera
Reviews.Author: David A. Riley
Reviews.Content: I have had a succession of Sony's and currently use the DSCH50 and a pocket sized Cybershot DSCW5 as a constant companion.The DSCH50 is an excellent product with a large tiltable LCD screen, excellent lens quality, a more than adequate 15 x optical zoom and a pretty hefty 9.1 megapixels.  The image stabilization system works very well as does the night mode for taking shots in limited light without flash.  I have also been impressed with the performance of the Macro mode, especially as I like to photograph flowers.I have been delighted with picture quality which is superb for this price point.  The ability to use up to a 16mb card also gives more than enough capacity for my needs.The unit is well constructed, very intuitive to use (this could be because I have had several Sony cameras) and the ergonomics are excellent.  There are several modes from fully automatic point and shoot through to almost fully manual operation which gives the user a wide range of artistic options if required.On the negative side it is a little large (although not heavy) but still way more manageable than an SLR.  The LCD is poor in bright sunlight in common with most of the digital cameras I have used.  I also found some of the features such as smile capture a tad gimmicky for my taste.In conclusion I am very pleased with my latest Sony camera.  I think this is an excellent unit for someone who wants high quality shots, a good zoom range, but doesn't want to or can't step out for an SLR.  A serious camera at a great price point.

Reviews.Title: Review of Sony Cybershot DSC h50
Reviews.Author: G. Routledge
Reviews.Content: Overall, it does what it says.  I looked at all the digital review sites and found that this was great value at the price band I was looking at.  I'd used an older Sony Cybershot at work so I knew roughly what to expect which was excellent photos !!!I love the flip-out screen - great for taking photos at really strange angles (above / below etc)The burst & continuous modes are fun also to capture more candid shots when people expect the picture to have been taken.  The smile mode really works too !!!The wide angle and zoom are good, however if you need really long zoom then invest in an SLR with the appropriate lens.  this is perfect for what I need though.Lots of other modes which I am just experimenting with but basically it is extremely flexible.Overall a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent choice for amateurs who want to act like pros
Reviews.Author: Aman Datta "Aman Datta"
Reviews.Content: I certainly fit the category of an amateur photographer trying to act more pro like and this camera feels great.  I am a Sony loyalist though I did do some research on Nikon before buying this camera (I had earlier bought a Sony Cybershot in which I was very disappointed).  It is a very easy to use camera and its pictures are awesome.  ISO of 100 is normally good for most photos and I would recommend P (if ISO gets too noisy).  Ignore the "Easy" (for some reason I get terrible photos) and certainly use the Burst feature.  It is great at sporting events.  The zoom is incredible and while people have complained about the irregular size of the ring/hood, it really makes no difference to me since I plan to simply use the camera as is.In short, it is a great camera for amateurs.  It has a perfect blend of pro-like features with the ease of use for an amateur.  My only gripe is the lens cover is rather flimsy and I am always afraid it will break or fall off (That has not happened as yet)...

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Laura
Reviews.Content: I used to have an old pocket sized Sony Cybershot with 3X Zoom. I wanted a camera with much better zoom and shutter speed. After much research, I decided on the Sony Cybershot DSCH50. I love the fast shutter speed and the 15x zoom.  Still learning all the many functions of my Sony H50 but so far I LOVE it!  I don't think I'll ever be upset with my decision to purchase this camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for advanced user and great lens hood
Reviews.Author: Pui Yin Wong "Jessica S. W"
Reviews.Content: Great camera for advanced user. I just got the camera today from sonystyle store in Madison ave. I like it. I had an olympus u-mini and love the image quality. SonyH50 have a big zoom but and the smile feature. on the other hand, SOny H50 has a metal lens hoods often protect better than non-petal (round) types.  This is because petal-style hoods take into account the aspect ratio of the camera's film or digital sensor, and so the angle of view is greater in one direction than the other.If the lens hood is inadequate, there are some easy but less convenient workarounds.  Placing a hand or piece of paper exterior to the side of the lens which is nearest the flare-inducing light source can mimic the effect of a proper lens hood.  On the other hand, it is sometimes hard to gauge when this makeshift hood will accidentally become part of the picture.  A more expensive solution used by many pros is using adjustable bellows.  This is just a lens hood which adjusts to precisely match the field of view for a given focal length.Generally, It's great, but the general image quality is pretty good, not the top. the camera itself is really light, out of my expectation.

Reviews.Title: Did not like this camera!
Reviews.Author: T. A. Kent
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure if I got a lemon, but I hated this camera!!  Shots taken outside in bright light were fine, but all shots inside were terrible!  I had this for a couple months and got rid of it.  Now I've moved on to an SLR.  I would not recommend this camera for a second.

Reviews.Title: Sony DSC-H50
Reviews.Author: gwc "gwcoates@comcast.net"
Reviews.Content: I am not a good photographer. I like to take snapshots, and I like to shoot short movies with my camera.  In some settings, the time between the pressing of the button and the opening of the shutter is 2-3 seconds.  The shot I had intended is lost.  In some settings, the snap is immediate; so I will use only those.The battery charge is not very durable when doing short movies.  The quality of the movies is great, but the battery charge goes down vertically when taking them.I have a Lumix FX6 which takes a lesser quality movie, but will do 1/2 hour with no problem and still have plenty of battery left.  The Lumix will also do snapshots faster than the Sony.I guess I can learn to live with these shortcomings, given the quality of product it performs.In spite of my lack of expertise, I have taken spectacular shots of active sports, smiling people, portraits and scenery.I must confess, however, I was quite shocked at these shortcomings.gwcArlington, Va

Reviews.Title: Great zoom, great macro
Reviews.Author: Jake Mate
Reviews.Content: I'm been using this camera for 6 months, and I really likes the quality of pictures taken. When I use the full zoom the clarity on the LCD screen and the capability to move it in different angles is very useful above all in light conditions. Macro options also is amazing because the picture have pro quality. If you want to take wildlife, specially birds, I'll recomend use in sports mode + continous shoots. I'm very satisfied with this camera. Highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: Initial impression
Reviews.Author: Mark Johnson
Reviews.Content: As an amateur photographer, the cybershot dsc h50 looks to be and has everything I need feature wise to make my photo taking better and more enjoyable.  Good value for the dollars spent.

Reviews.Title: An excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Sabriel McMannus "graywolf70"
Reviews.Content: For a wanna-be pro photographer.I am no where near a professional photographer, but this camera sure makes me feel like I'm getting there. I have had no problems with it, and it takes beautiful clear pictures. I will admit that in extremely lo-light conditions the dark areas of the pictures are really noisy. But that ok because in every other setting the pictures are beautiful, clear, and crisp. The long zoom, 15x optical, is a god-send. Just imagine, you're outside one evening and look, deer! You can get the shot without scaring them off. I definetly recommend this camera to any budding photographer.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber-shot 9.1 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Javier Piza Vargas "- JPizáV"
Reviews.Content: I was amazed from the first photo. Takes great pictures even when in motion and not using the sports mode. This is just a great product.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I've ever had.
Reviews.Author: N. Tuttle
Reviews.Content: I'm really an amatuer at photography, but I do like to take pictures as a hobby.  I was using a Nikon Coolpix 8200.  It was good for family pictures of days at the park, but I really needed something that I could get a good zoom with and detail.  I shopped for a long time and settled on the H50.  It's everything that I need.  It takes awesome pics without having to put a lot of thought into it.  It is just about the perfect medium between SLR and point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Worth buying DSC H-50
Reviews.Author: Santhosh
Reviews.Content: I have done lots of research to buy Sony DSC H-50, the main reason i liked on this product is the Remote and Tilting display apart from the other features... i play around a lot with the remote you can control almost everything from the Cam, and the tilting display will suite all your needs.I have an tie with Nikon P80, but when i compared with quality of the image i found Sony was good, the clarity of the color is very impressive. I bought this Cam on end of December,08 its been almost two months over i am really happy with it!

Reviews.Title: Packs A Lot For The Price!!
Reviews.Author: T. Cramer
Reviews.Content: I take this hobby seriously and Sony always offers a nice camera, no matter which one you buy. I have the T300 but in the winter, with gloves on, its a bit too small to hold onto. I looked into the H50 and the side grip takes care of that problem, which is the main reason I bought this. The 15X zoom is wonderfull too. No need to carry a lot of equipment and extra lenses. I have a Nikon D80, too, and sometimes I dont want to carry a heavy camera for the type of photography Im going after so the H50 takes care of that issue, too. While this wont fit in my purse like the T300, and it doesnt have interchangeable lenses like my Nikon D80, this one is a perfect "in between" type camera. I have researched a lot of cameras and find this one to be great. The pictures come out nice and sharp. If you are considering this, just buy it. You wont be sorry!

Reviews.Title: Very thrilled with our camera
Reviews.Author: Bruce
Reviews.Content: After buying item was shipped extremely fast. Found everything to be just as camera  was described on line. I bought it mainly for taking pictures of my morgan silver dollars to sell on line. It does a really good job of taking  extremely closeup shots easily gets in really tight and shows every little detail of coins. Its so good at closeups that this camera does almost as good as the higher dollar cameras costing 3 to 4 times more than this one did. I bought this camera for my self and for the coin pictures only but my wife took it outside and started to using it after we seen the great pictures it took we gave away most of our other cameras.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber-shot DSCH 50 9.1MP
Reviews.Author: Digipic guy
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as an "in between" camera when I need more than a point and click but less than my Canon 350D.  Since I have alot of Sony electronics (VAIO, TV, Handycam, DSW120), I felt safe giving this a try.The zoom and sutter speed give me what I was looking for but this is still not Digital SLR quality, nor is it promoted to be. However, if you do not have extraordinary requirements and simply want to do some better shooting than a standard "point and click", then this is a good unit.I have used it in snowy conditions and beach conditions and it functioned fine.  Battery life is very good.  Picture quality is good provided you do not "over zoom".

Reviews.Title: Outstanding!
Reviews.Author: Eric Torres
Reviews.Content: This camera is simply amazing. I love the kinds of control that is given with the camera, and the interface that is offered with the camera is outstandingly easy to use and understand.With some of the shots that I've taken, especially some of my first, they look SPECTACULAR. In general, many of the shots that I've taken look 'picture-perfect'. The high resolution of the photos make the pictures look spectacular, and some of the ones I've taken - especially since I'm more of a scenery shot person - look surreal, and I really enjoy the way the shots came out.I especially love how it's considered to be a 'bridge' camera, so that way it already has its own built-in lens and the ability to install and attach its own Sony lens, which will come to be very useful eventually.All in all, this is an amazing camera.

Reviews.Title: Here comes Grandma
Reviews.Author: Judith C. Willis "willisocala"
Reviews.Content: The Sony DSCH50 was purchased as an upgrade to my Canon A80 digital camera that I've used for the past 5 years (not interested in an SLR camera).  Although I loved my Canon, my young granddaughter became quicker than the shutter button (the Energizer bunny has nothing on her!).  The Burst mode is perfect and I can control the number of shots taken.  The Zoom is also great for the wildlife in my area.  Wish I had this camera last Spring when a fox family took up residence under our shed (Mama fox didn't want me close to her babies).I'm still figuring out all the functions but find the Menu and Control buttons to be fairly intuitive.  I like having separate buttons for the most used features (zoom, burst, nightshot, playback).  The Slideshow button (w/music) is also a nice feature.The lens cap is a bit of an annoyance since I always forget to remove--first--before turning on the camera.  Waiting for Sony to get an LCD screen protector for this model since I'm not sure about how to protect the screen from accidental scratches.Overall, I'm excited about my Sony DSCH50 digital camera and Amazon had the best price (along with free shipping).  What a pair!

Reviews.Title: Very happy with this camera
Reviews.Author: jenpt8
Reviews.Content: We upgraded from a 2 mega pixel canon.  We are point and shoot photographers who just tinker with the features.  We are very pleased with this camera.  Clear pictures, great features.  Still figuring them all out.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, so-so battery
Reviews.Author: Tom Frey
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to carry in my bike bag  as a lightweight alternative to my Minolta Maxuum 5D.  I wanted aperture mode and a large zoom range.  The zoom works very well, and the camera takes excellent photos (though I still prefer the 5D). There are three drawbacks. The first is that the battery's charge does not last long. I'd recommend purchasing a second battery so that you can switch them out and extend the time that you can work with the camera. The second is that the viewfinder is tiny--I find it much easier to steady the camera when using the view finder, rather than the LCD display.  Third, it is difficult to adjust the zoom.  It moves too quickly and I have difficulty landing on the framing that I prefer.  Oh,  and there is a fourth.  If the size format of the photos is adjustable, I have not found how to do that yet. I would prefer a 4" X 6" format. All of the other settings are easy to interpret because, this camera, like my MacBook, tells me what the setting is when I turn to it.  I find this feature extremely useful.  I can never recall what all those little icons and setting letters mean. I'm also enjoying the movie mode, which works well.  All-in-all, I'm satisfied.  The life of the battery is pretty annoying though.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this camera!
Reviews.Author: BB
Reviews.Content: This camera may have the infamous shutter release problem that Sony will not or does not acknowledge but will repair for well over $150.00 once the camera is back in the owners hands. The quick fixes replacing the shutter release button with the same plastic failure as supplied with the camera does not work or work for long. Several references to this major flaw on any search engine.

Reviews.Title: Love This Camera!
Reviews.Author: StarsUp
Reviews.Content: I've owned this camera for years. I've advanced so much with this camera, and still have more to learn. For a while I thought I needed an SLR to advance, but I've realized this Sony does everything! All the features new SLR's brag about, this camera already does, and has been out for years. The live view, tilting screen, night shot mode, 1080p HD recording, etc. The only drawback is lenses. You can't walk into a store and buy lenses for it. You have to have an adapter tube just for filters too because of the optical lens. That aside it's still cheaper than buying an SLR + all the lenses you need.This camera is only help back by the photographer. Learn to use the manual modes!! You can do exposures with it too (up to 30 sec.) and I've gotten some stunning pics from it. People ask me what I shoot with all the time. A "full featured" point & shoot :) This camera is perfect for someone wanting to advance, or just take better quality pictures. Or for someone that shoots with an SLR but maybe also wants a simplified every day camera.The lens and zoom is outstanding for a p&s.; I get good bokeh in the background on close up shots. You can get technical about your pics, or use the automatic settings whenever you want.Quality can't be beat with this camera either. I have never had it act up or anything break. Even after my dog chewed on it a little lol It's been going strong for several years and I'm not looking to replace it before it dies. Battery life is excellent too. I carry a couple of spares because I've been known to shoot a hundred some photos every time I take it out. But if I start with a fully charged battery, all I'll use is one. I use it in extreme cold and 100+ degree weather without a hitch.Learn how to use everything on this Sony and you'll be amazed at what you can do with photography.Bottom line, I absolutely love my H50!!!

Reviews.Title: Great quality for price
Reviews.Author: tarak
Reviews.Content: This camera gives high quality pictures for a reasonable price. I'm not skilled in photography... but I find the "easy" mode produces great photos! I'm sure if I knew how to properly use the other modes they would be fantastic :) The battery life is good and seems to charge quickly. We've had this camera for 3 years now and still love it!! Have had no problems. The guy at the store kept pushing us to buy a Canon, but I'm sure glad we went with the Sony in this case.

Reviews.Title: good cam
Reviews.Author: JRH "JRH"
Reviews.Content: good camera.i'm a little disappointed in low light and in processor speed.  Pics in low light are grainy and if you want a shot instantly to catch a particular moment you have to guess how far ahead to push the button.  The lag time is unacceptable for a camera of this quality and technology.BUT, in good light this camera takes excellent shots and the zoom/stabilization works really well.  You can freehand some really good shots at 15x zoom for an affordable point-N-shoot with factory settings, that's outstanding.

Reviews.Title: GREAT PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: Shawn E. Christo "toronto1449"
Reviews.Content: This is the best Camera, very easy to use,great pictures... wish i would have bought it before i wasted money on others!!!

Reviews.Title: If you want a view finder, forget it!
Reviews.Author: Larry J. Mcdonald "Harley Guy"
Reviews.Content: I'll be brief,I wanted a portable camera but I need a viewfinder esp in sunney weather. The back LCD viewfinder is OK but like all I've seen suck in sunlight. The Through the Lens view finder sucks to the point I would return the product if it wern't such a pain in the butt. This camera is third party vendor so not so easy to deal with as direct Amazon purchase. Would not do it AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: Fun camera
Reviews.Author: N. Bowers "Average Joe"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in April (when the price was $299).  Some of the features that I have come to love about it are:most impressed with action photos- great pics, no blur, great detail (must be in well lit place)- if planning on taking a lot of action shots indoor (basketball, wrestling, etc.  I don't think I would recommend this camera unless the gym is well lit- for outdoor shots the pics are beautiful)when you are viewing pictures if you lightly touch the snap button it will instantly take you back to the picture taking mode- which helps catch those moments- I didn't realize how much I loved this feature until some family members asked me to use their cameras to take some pictures- I had to switch modes on their cameras and realized how much time you loose.really like being able to crop the pictures on the camera- gives you the option to zoom while cropping which is a feature I was always interested in finding in a camera or photo softwarethe video options are fun- can record in b/w, sepia, and a few other colorsthe zoom is great- I was at my daughters school play and I was in the back of the auditorium but the zoom made it seem like I was in the front rowthe slide show with music is funthe LCD screen pulls out and that's funVery, very happy with the camera- have received a lot of compliments on picturesalso, you can find extra batteries for cheap prices- I ordered one on line for $12 (including tax and s/h)The only reason that I gave the camera 4 stars is b/c the camera is now $599 and for that price I would expect a better picture for the action shots in low lighting- all other features have exceeded expectations.

Reviews.Title: I Love My Sony H50
Reviews.Author: Kady21
Reviews.Content: After returning a Canon Sure-Shot I received, and did not like at all, I did a lot of searching reviews before deciding on the H50. Even then I still wasnt sure it would be the camera for me. I have to say that so far I have been more than satisfied with the ease of use and quality of this camera. I have taken over 200 photos and other than due to my own errors each photo has come out wonderfuly. I havent gotten the hang of a few of the options and settings but even the basic ones take great pics. The color and clarity come out crisp and detailed. Photos of moving objects are well defined and stop action seems to work better than I had expected. The super steady shot is great, it really prevents blurring and the viewfinder or screen option is great. Battery life seems fairly good but I will get a second battery to have on hand. I have used this for about 3 weeks and so far I am glad I chose the H50. If I can take a good photo I would imagine anyone can

Reviews.Title: Great mid-range camera
Reviews.Author: W. Wright
Reviews.Content: This camera is fabulous!  Completely met expectations.  One of the ONLY cameras with a remote shutter release.  Powerful features for the amateur photographer looking for a great camera at a mid-range price.

Reviews.Title: From a novice
Reviews.Author: James Williams
Reviews.Content: I am not an expert in photography nor am I very experienced at using photographic equipment, but I am very pleased with the pictures from my DSCH50.  I have only had it for about one month but I have taken it on a two week vacation and learned something new on just about every picture.  I am most impressed with it's "low light" reproduction.  The pictures I like the most are the ones I took inside the cruise ship with no flash.  I find the camera to be very user friendly.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!
Reviews.Author: M.N. "maddie"
Reviews.Content: Well, I have always been an Olympus fan. I have two Olympus digital cameras and a canon point and shoot. I loooooove to take photos. I was a little undecided on getting the Sony, since I was not sure how the photo quality was going to be. I recieved the camera on the 2nd of April. It has alot of great features, it's preety fast and takes preety good photos. I still love my Olympus but i needed something that was faster, it takes fantastic pics but is slow. In December I went to Disney and missed alot of great shots because of this. I still love it.....But I also Love my Sony camera. I do recomend it!!!

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber-shot DSCH50
Reviews.Author: Rick B "Rick"
Reviews.Content: I have had the camera for about a month now & I love it.  I love the big 3" lcd screen.  The camera is everything its advertised to be.  The only con to this camera would be the lens cap.  If you forget to take the cap off before you turn the camera on the lens will move out & pop the lens cap off.  Its such a nice camera it should have a nicer lens cap.  All in all I would defenitely recommend the camera.

Reviews.Title: Just great
Reviews.Author: Nicolas Encina "Nicko"
Reviews.Content: Excellent price, amazing quality of image, is a great product, easy to use and carry. The shipment was very fast i have no complains !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Is what I expected to be, good camera
Reviews.Author: Jean Lostaunau "Jean Lostaunau"
Reviews.Content: Hi, I'm from Peru, South America. A friend of mine was coming to Peru, it cost me like half price to get this camera from the USA than bying it here... happens.About the camera, it is good, fast, several good functions, good battery life. It takes a little to get used to the several options, but it works nicely. This is what they call a "prosumer" product, for someone that wants some more than over the regular user.The only flaw I see here is the location of the zoom. If you hold the camera with one hand only, you will probably push the zoom without noticing. Is a matter to get used to it.I'm a fan from Sony products, none of them have ever dissapointed me. Now, if you are looking for something just to point and shot, maybe you shoudl try with the new slim ones with touchscreen, they are amazing. But if you want some more, like better lens, different speeds and ISO control, this is the one for starting with. I think my next two ones will be a digital SLR for working, and a slim touchscreen one for fun.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber-Shot
Reviews.Author: A. Sedillo
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera. This replaced a Sony 4.1 mp camera with a Carl Zeiss lens (lens makes the camera). The 9.1 out performs the 4.1 by leaps and bounds. Sony got smart and stopped including a ridiculously small memory stick as well. It's worth getting the 4-gig stick. Even recording a short movie with the 9.1 turns out nicer. I have not used the zoom capabilities but other reviews I have read say the 9.1 is way better than the 8.1 resolution with zoom and movies.This 9.1 has a pop up flash and LCD view screen, great features. I did not think I would use the flip LCD, but it comes in handy with shots of kids and other subjects that would ordinaraly require bending down or squating making my shutter hand a little shaky.All in all an improved product with obvious research and development from it's predecessors, lighter weight, and less expensive to boot.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: D. Harris
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my Mom, and she loves it: great pictures without being so complicated that you need an advanced degree to operate it.

Reviews.Title: Cyber-shot
Reviews.Author: Thomas Kinsella
Reviews.Content: Awesome Camera! Does everything that is listed.  The night vision is an interesting feature.

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted!
Reviews.Author: B. Curtis "Chickenfeed"
Reviews.Content: For years I've been jealous of my daughter and son-in-law's cameras! I wanted something I could use to get great shots of all those precious moments that happen and never come again. This year I was able to afford a better grade camera, digital, to compliment my passion for scrapping! My oldest daughter suggested I check on Amazon before I buy in the local stores! When did she get so smart? She was right. I have had my Sony Cyber-shot for about a month and I love it! I'm still learning all I can do with it. But I will learn. And I can take all kinds of pics until I get good at it and don't have to pay to have it developed! I'm so glad I bought this camera!Sony Cyber-shot DSCH50 9.1 MP Digital Camera with 15x Optical Zoom with Super Steady Shot

Reviews.Title: DSC-H50 User Review
Reviews.Author: Ronald Jones "silent knight"
Reviews.Content: This is the best digital camera I have ever used. Out performs my digital SLR in every way at a fraction of the cost. Very easy to use in the two automatic modes, plenty of manual controls for creative input. An ultra clear 3" LCD. When you pick this up and take a few shots and then compare it to it's peers that are on display (as in Best Buy or Circuit City) you realize that the others can't hold a candle to it. Great battery life (replacement battery $50 in stores but $25 on-line with free shipping). All in all, at $300 too expensive for the occasional snap shot shooter but if you are considering going to a SLR but are shy to take the plunge due to the prices... this is the camera for you. Also the flash will fill a room from 20 feet away (doesn't need aux flash) and doesn't have a cheap plastic feel is as some in it's class do.

Reviews.Title: Simply Amazing!!!
Reviews.Author: K. A. Nagel
Reviews.Content: I picked out this camera by comparing similiar models from different manufacturers online, only. I kept coming back to this Sony Cybershot - it had so many good features I was looking for and the price seemed very competitive. Then I finally decided to buy, and get it for a Xmas gift to me. Having gotten it and used it for the holidays and more...I can not say enough about how truly GREAT it is. The speed of the picture taking is almost a miracle, the crispness of every photo is to be envied. Also after getting the camera, I discovered it had even more features that I love...like that I can purchase an add on telephoto lens, and a wide lens...the tele is definitely on my wish list...It has a slideshow playback with music selections and the neatest special effects. I have only begun to use this camera to its fullest measure...but it is my third digital camera, and BY FAR the BEST that I have ever owned. And then my daughter wanted a new camera for Xams too and she purchased one of their small compact cameras...and she too loves what she got!!!

Reviews.Title: Good choice
Reviews.Author: Juan Manuel Ferrero "En dos ruedas"
Reviews.Content: Good choice, good camera but limitation to deliver to Latinamerica, so I had to ask for delivery to Miami and then find somebody to bring it to Venezuela, it would be good to solve this issueThanks

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber Shot DSCH50
Reviews.Author: Mikky's Girl
Reviews.Content: This is a very easy to use and FUN camera.  This is my first digital camera.  I have always been a film type so when I started using this camera I was not at all intimidated.  I enjoy the option of manual v. program and well as the view finder rather than only the view screen. I would like to be able to have interchangeable lens but that wasn't going to stop me from buying this camera.  This camera is fun and easy first step into the digital world of photography.  Now all I need to master is the software to manipulate the images.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: L. L. Ingher "dragonlady"
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from a Sony DSCH5 with 7.2 MP and am very pleased with this camera. I used it at our annual holiday party and got great shots. Having a remote is a real bonus for group shots that include me.  I am used to having nightshot capability which I didn't have with the H5. This one has it and now I can take shots of our pond in the Spring with the frogs & toads serenading with their little throats throbbing. Taking video is great too. I would highly recommend this camera. It's small enough to carry with me most of the time and get those unexpected shots otherwise missed.

Reviews.Title: Just What I ordered
Reviews.Author: Carrie Ashton
Reviews.Content: Based on the other reviews I would say that this product is exactly what I thought I was going to get. It proved to be a great camera for artistic macro photography, and relatively good for every day use. The one downside for me is the delay, but if I didn't want that I should have ordered an SLR. Also the accessories for this camera are clumsy and not very useful, don't buy any of the extra lenses.

Reviews.Title: Sony again
Reviews.Author: Zsolt Vegh
Reviews.Content: The best, best, best. Easy to shoot with in any  lite condition. Very fast.The best auto digital cam with a great lens.Even if objects mooving pictures are great. Focuses real far  like three football fields  and pictures are real clear. I just bought it and took my SLR, big  camera back for a full refund.  It loads to the computer  fastest I have ever experienced. It is great fun to watch pictures with a play options, like a movie. OH it is made in JAPAN not China .

Reviews.Title: I love my new Sony DSC-H50 Camera!
Reviews.Author: Mike J. Hargrave
Reviews.Content: I used to own the DSC-H5, but decided to upgrade to the DSC-H50.  I like the new features!  It has a night shot switch that lets you take pictures in the dark!  It uses night vision technology.  The DSC-H5 has 7.2 MP and 12X zoom.  This one has 9 MP and 15X zoom.  Buy this camera!

Reviews.Title: sony cybershot camera review by ray sipe
Reviews.Author: Raymond Sipe "ray sipe"
